results.title: The Threepenny opera = L'opera de quat' sous. Die Dreigroschenoper
results.creator_credit: G Pabst, Seymour Nebenzal, Warner Brothers First National Productions, Nero-Film and Tobis Filmkunst
results.brief_description: In 19th Century London, Mack the Knife, a small-time criminal, marries Polly, the daughter of beggar-king, Peachum, and finds himself in a lot of trouble. In the early years of the sound era, film producers often made films in different language versions, using the same sets but different casts for each version. Pabst followed this practice with his twin versions of ‘The Threepenny Opera’ in German and French- ‘Die Driegroschenoper’(98 min.) and ‘L’Opera de Quat’ Sous’(105 min.). The two versions offer rich material for comparison. The German version was originally released in 1931 amidst political and legal controversy. The Nazis, rankled by its socialist message and attacks on government authority, ordered the destruction of the original negative and every print that could be found. The film’s unavailability bolstered its legendary status and, after many years of searching, a complete negative was found and a restored version released in 1960. Music by Kurt Weill. From the play by Bertolt Brecht and Kurt Weill. In French and German with English subtitles.

results.title: The Three Stooges. Vols. 17,18,21
results.brief_description: Compilation of three videos starring the Three Stooges in some of their funniest films. Titles include “Crash goes the hash” (dir. Jules White); “Three pests in a mess” (dir. Del Lord); “Three trouble dooers” (dir. Edward Bernds); “Rusty romeos” (dir. Jules White); “Merry mixup” (dir. Jules White); “Quizz wizz” (dir. Jules White); “Slippery silks” (dir. Jack White); “Flat foot Stooges” (dir. Charley Chase); “Whoops I’m an Indian” (dir. Del Lord). The Three Stooges consisted of Moe Howard, Shemp Howard and Larry Fine.

results.title: The Three robbers (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Tomi Urgerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. Under Tiffany’s golden charm the robbers turn their gold to good use and all ends happily in this droll tale heightened by bold colourful illustrations.
results.description: Based on the story by Tomi Urgerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. results.title: The Three musketeers. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”
An edited version of the 1921 silent film version of the Dumas novel starring Douglas Fairbanks in the role of D’Artagnan, with added commentary. A cloak-and-dagger adventure romance with sequences of lively duels, chases and acrobatics, and the drama of court intrigue, illustrating the silent action film at its best, adaptation of a popular novel to the screen, and the work of Fairbanks.

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The third talkie version of Alexander Dumas famed story of D’Artagnan - a young man seeking his fortune in 17th Century France. MGM created a splashy production with an all-star cast for this swashbuckling adventure movie, filmed in Technicolor. Gene Kelly gives the impression of having a fabulous time playing the title role of a young anti-authoritarian upstart, a talented swordsman with an eye for attractive ladies of the Court. D’Artagnan joins the three musketeers, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, in order to save their beleageared queen from disgrace. To do so they much face the Machiavellian Milady De Winter and Richelieu. The film, a curious mix of melodrama and burlesque, was one of the top earning films of 1948.

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Roger Birnbaum, Joe Roth and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This Disney adaptation of the classic 17th century French novel by Alexandre Dumas features Chris O’Donnell in the lead role of the swashbuckling hero D’Artagnan, a musketeer in the King’s guards in Paris. When D’Artagnan discovers that the scheming Cardinal Richelieu (Tim Curry) is plotting to oust the King from his throne, he joins up with three other musketeers - Athos (Kiefer Sutherland), Porthos (Oliver Platt), and Aramis (Charlie Sheen) - to protect King and country and thwart the unscrupulous Cardinal’s plans. Also stars Rebeccca De Mornay as Milady de Winter. Beautiful cinematography by Dean Semler and lavish costuming and set design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Herek, Roger Birnbaum, Joe Roth and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: The Three monks (K)
results.brief_description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.
